page.title: 08LITTER
page.content: THE AMOUNT OF LITTER IN DIFFERENT LOCATIONS AROUND THE SCHOOL WAS COUNTED. {1 }Small children's park. {2 }Shopping Centre {3 }Housing Estate {4 }Fast food shop {5 }Children's play- ground {6 }Park. {LOCATION} { 1 2 3 4 5 6 Sweet papers etc. 20 10 14 07 03 21 Cigarette Ends 00 21 14 02 24 19 Matches/Lolly stick5 11 04 05 06 01 Bags/Paper 02 05 04 04 02 08 Bags/Plastic 06 00 01 02 03 00 Bottles/Can tops 01 05 01 26 02 05 Cartons 01 00 04 01 01 00 Paper/Used tickets03 14 18 06 01 01 This was the amount of litter seen by one child in 3 minutes. There was less small litter on country roads but there were occassional large items like mattresses and old cars. We were most worried by the number of aluminium can tops and plastic items.
